description: Strengthening the Capacity of People's Elected Bodies in Viet Nam (Phase II)

subproject.description:
This Project aims to strengthen the capacities of the National Assembly (and its Secretariat) and People’s Councils to perform its constitutional functions, while increasing transparency and accountability and to develop a strategic training programme for deputies at both central and local levels. The Project will also provide support to the decentralisation process with a special focus on Provincial People’s Councils.  The development objective of the Project is to strengthen the Rule of Law in Viet Nam, facilitate democracy, protecting people rights and legal interests and enable the public participation.

The main results/ outcome of the project are:
•	Enhanced capacity of members of the parliament (MPs) to initiate, analyse, debate and amend bills. 
•	Improved legal drafting skills of technical staff of the ONA
•	Strengthened research and analysis capacity at the ONA in support of the legislative functions of the NA.
•	Informed national policy debate on the amendment of the Law on Organisation of the People’s Councils and People’s Committees; Law on People’s Council deputies election
•	Streamlined, effective and efficient lawmaking process
•	Improved relationships between MPs’ and their respective voters and constituencies
•	Development of regular public consultations process as the methodology to assess the impact of policies and legislation.
•	Improved process of management of petitions and complaints from the public at large, at the NA.
•	Strengthened co-ordination of the NA and its Committees and Vietnam development partners on sector-wide issues such as poverty, WTO, decentralisation policies, HIV/AIDS, etc.
•	Enhanced parliamentary administration and management of parliamentary affairs
•	Orientation needs of the MPs and training needs of the ONA staff, PCs’ deputies and their staff addressed
•	Improved institutional capacities at People’s Councils
